abstract.p: Henry Alford humorous Op-Ed article on following lead of Stephen King and publishing book on Internet

block.p: Mr. King is trusting his readers to send him a dollar after each download . . . . If he does not receive payments for at least 75 percent of the downloads, he says, he will stop writing after two chapters, and readers won't learn the end.
-- The New York Times on Stephen King's plans to publish a new book online.
I will continue to write this e-book if . . .

Mr. King is trusting his readers to send him a dollar after each download . . . . If he does not receive payments for at least 75 percent of the downloads, he says, he will stop writing after two chapters, and readers won't learn the end.
-- The New York Times on Stephen King's plans to publish a new book online.
I will continue to write this e-book if . . .
. . . I can be paid in cigarettes.
. . . I can be assured that no critic will ever again, in connection with my work, employ the phrase ''amusing regional miniaturist.''
. . . a reality-based television show can be built around my writing of the book.
. . . the editorial assistant at my former publishing house -- the tall one, with the voice -- will make a series of fawning phone calls to my home between the hours of 5 p.m. and 7 p.m.
. . . the next time I give a reading at a superstore, the management will rid the environment of spitty cappuccino machines, couples going through difficult break-ups, and storyteller-clowns.
. . . in all previous reviews and criticism of my work, the word ''effective'' will be replaced with ''canonical.''

. . . I can be assured that the book's publication will anger one of my competitors and lead to an exchange of increasingly petty correspondence in the letters section of a prominent book review, the publication of a snipey memoir or a lawsuit, preferably in London during the theater season.
. . . my computer can be equipped to create, at my prompting, the sound of applause.
Henry Alford is the author of ''Big Kiss: One Actor's Desperate Attempt to Claw His Way to the Top.''
